intro: [WRONG START] Astellia veratroides var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender swamp aster, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in New Zealand. It features upright, slender stems that bear small, clustered flowers in shades of white to pale purple. The leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, adapted to thrive in moist, often boggy conditions. This variety is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
